conclusion: Understanding acceleration and its relation to the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows velocity increasing initially, then decreasing, and finally increasing again.
Identify acceleration from the graph by observing the slope of the line at each point.
At 1 second, the velocity is 20 m/s, and at 2 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.
The slope of the line at 1 second is steeper than at 2 seconds, indicating greater acceleration.
Since velocity decreases from 20 m/s to 10 m/s, acceleration must be decreasing from 1 to 2 seconds.
Verify that decrease in velocity corresponds to decrease in acceleration as slope decreases from steeper to shallower.
Conclude that particle's acceleration is indeed decreasing from 1 to 2 seconds.
Yes, it is correct to say that the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
